situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The gadwall has a piano. The swallow has a card that is black in color, and is currently in  Hamburg. The coyote does not unite with the woodpecker. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If there is evidence that one animal, no matter which one, dances with the poodle, then the pigeon dances with the chihuahua undoubtedly. Rule2: The gadwall will fall on a square of the pigeon if it (the gadwall) has a musical instrument. Rule3: If something does not unite with the woodpecker, then it dances with the poodle. Rule4: Here is an important piece of information about the swallow: if it has a card whose color appears in the flag of Belgium then it does not fall on a square that belongs to the pigeon for sure. Rule5: The swallow will not fall on a square of the pigeon if it (the swallow) is in France at the moment.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the pigeon dance with the chihuahua?
label: proved
